The difficult conversations between Israeli and Palestinian peace activists
subhead: The anti-occupation NGO Combatants for Peace works to organize joint actions between young people living in the West Bank and in Israel. The group faces the challenge of rebuilding trust between both sides, torn apart by two years of war in Gaza.

subhead: Ukrainian anti-corruption authorities said earlier that they had raided the home of Andriy Yermak, who has been accused of involvement in a $100 million kickback scheme in the energy sector.

title: Louvre heist: All suspected members of the commando group now charged
subhead: A man suspected of being the fourth and final accomplice in the team that stole jewels from the Louvre in broad daylight has been placed in provisional detention. He was already known to authorities.

title: The housing crisis is fueling the far-right vote
subhead: In France, a growing share of the population is struggling to find housing. The shortage, which especially affects the working and middle classes, is generating resentment with consequences at the ballot box.

title: Germany pushes ahead to become Europe's leading space power
subhead: Member states of the European Space Agency, meeting in Bremen, approved a €22.1 billion budget for 2026-2028 – a 32% increase. Germany will contribute €5.1 billion, or 23% of the funds, taking on a leadership role in Europe's space program.

Four reasons French winegrowers are angry
subhead: Wine production in 2025 is expected to match that of 2024, which was already a disastrous year. Le Monde examines the four main factors behind this downturn.

title: Why our old clothes end up in the UAE
subhead: The country has emerged as a leader in sorting secondhand clothing, taking advantage of Europe's inability to process its own stockpiles. This outsourcing comes with clear environmental and social costs.

title: Germany's pension reform becomes a generational conflict
subhead: The plan agreed upon by coalition members is to maintain pension levels despite the aging population. But it is opposed by young conservatives, who are calling for more sweeping reforms.
